title: Projection
subject: MongoDB
theory: Projection determines which fields are returned in the matching documents. This reduces network overhead by returning only necessary data.

examples.explanation: _id is included by default unless explicitly excluded.

common_mistakes.correction: You cannot mix 0 and 1 in projection, EXCEPT for _id.
common_mistakes.example: { name: 1, age: 0 } // Error. either include specific or exclude specific.

interview_questions.question: Can you exclude fields in a projection?

real_world_use_cases.description: Never returning sensitive 'password_hash' or internal flags to the client.

summary: Projection is key for performance (bandwidth) and security (hiding sensitive fields).
